# modelFileURL(for:)

**Instance Method**

Provides a URL to a 3D model based on the given object’s attributes or category.

## Declaration

```swift
func modelFileURL(for object: CapturedRoom.Object) throws -> URL?
```

## Parameters

- **object**: The object whose attributes and category represent criteria for the model-URL query.

## Return Value

The 3D model that the app associates to the given object’s attributes via [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/ModelProvider/setModelFileURL(_:for:)-8xio] or its category via [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/ModelProvider/setModelFileURL(_:for:)-4law9]; or, `nil` if no 3D model URL associates to the given object’s category or combination of attributes.

## Discussion

In error conditions, this function throws:

- [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/ModelProvider/Error/nonExistingFile(url:)] if a 3D model doesn’t exist at the given URL.
- [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/ModelProvider/Error/attributeCombinationNotSupported] if no object category supports all of the argument attributes.

Query [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom/Object/Category-swift.enum/supportedCombinations] to check the attributes that an object category supports.

## Managing models

- **modelFileURLs**: An array of URLs to 3D models for all categories and attributes.
- **modelFileURL(for:)**: Provides a URL to the 3D model for the given category.
- **modelFileURL(for:)**: Provides a URL to the 3D model for the given attributes.
- **setModelFileURL(_:for:)**: Associates a URL to the given attributes.
- **setModelFileURL(_:for:)**: Associates a URL to the given object category.
